Bà bắt đầu tham gia vào các hoạt động cộng đồng, kết bạn với những người mới và tìm kiếm những cơ hội để phát triển bản thân. Dù cuộc sống ở thị trấn nhỏ không hoàn hảo, nhưng bà đã tìm thấy một sự cân bằng mới cho cuộc sống của mình.

es_results_raw: La señora Dashwood comenzó a planificar su partida con una meticulosidad que sorprendió incluso a sí misma. Había recorrido cada rincón de Norland, y aunque cada lugar le recordaba momentos intensos, también le proporcionaba una paz que comenzaba a apreciar. Decidió llevar consigo un pequeño diario en el que anotaría sus recuerdos y sentimientos, creyendo que así podría mantener viva la conexión con ese lugar que tanto había significado para ella. En las noches, mientras el viento soplaba fuerte a través de las ventanas abiertas, se sentaba frente a la chimenea y releía sus notas, sintiendo una mezcla de nostalgia y gratitud. A medida que se acercaba la fecha de su partida, su impaciencia se transformó en una mezcla de emociones, ya que sabía que, aunque Norland ya no sería su hogar, sus recuerdos siempre la acompañarían. La señora Dashwood sabía que la vida continuaba, y aunque el dolor de la partida era inmenso, también sentía una esperanza renovada. Con cada paso que daba hacia la nueva etapa de su vida, sentía que estaba preparándose para enfrentar lo que vendría, con la promesa de que sus recuerdos de Norland siempre serían un tesoro valioso.

What feelings have I experienced that rival this joy? The sight of autumn leaves swirling and dancing in the breeze has always filled me with a sense of nostalgia and wonder. It is as if the world slows down, and for a moment, time itself becomes a fleeting memory. I have often imagined what it would be like to be one of those leaves, free from the constraints of life, yet still connected to the earth. The wind carries me away, and I feel a deep connection to nature, a bond that transcends words. This simple yet profound experience has shaped my understanding of beauty and impermanence, reminding me that even the most fleeting moments can leave an indelible mark on the soul."

en_first_half: "I have frequently detected myself in such kind of mistakes," said Elinor, "in a total misapprehension of character in some point or other: fancying people so much more gay or grave, or ingenious or stupid than they really are,
en_second_half: and I can hardly tell why or in what the deception originated. Sometimes one is guided by what they say of themselves, and very frequently by what other people say of them, without giving oneself time to deliberate and judge."
en_results: I often find myself falling into the same trap, underestimating someone's intellect or overestimating their emotional depth. It's a cycle I'm still trying to break, realizing that true character is often more nuanced than our initial
en_results_raw: I often find myself falling into the same trap, underestimating someone's intellect or overestimating their emotional depth. It's a cycle I'm still trying to break, realizing that true character is often more nuanced than our initial impressions. I've learned to pause and reflect before jumping to conclusions, but it's a lesson that continues to evolve with each new encounter. Sometimes, the most significant growth comes from recognizing our own biases and the limitations of our perceptions. It's a reminder that we are all works in progress, constantly shaping and being shaped by the world around us.

Điều này không chỉ giúp tôi hiểu người khác tốt hơn mà còn giúp tôi hiểu rõ hơn về chính mình. Tôi học được rằng sự kiên nhẫn và sự đồng cảm là những yếu tố quan trọng trong việc xây dựng mối quan hệ bền vững. Mỗi lần tôi có cơ hội để sửa chữa những hiểu lầm, tôi đều cảm thấy nhẹ nhõm và hài lòng hơn. Điều này đã giúp tôi trở nên tốt hơn trong việc giao tiếp và xây dựng các mối quan hệ cá nhân và chuyên nghiệp.

en_results_raw: Elinor saw, with great uneasiness the low spirits of her friend. His visit afforded her but a very partial satisfaction, while his own enjoyment in it appeared so imperfect. It was evident that he was unhappy; she wished it were equally evident that he still cherished some hope, some faint glimmer of light at the end of the tunnel. She longed to reach out and offer him the comfort she felt in her heart, but she knew that sometimes, people needed to find their own path to healing. She decided to simply be there for him, offering a listening ear and a steady presence. Over the next few days, she made it a point to visit him more often, hoping that her presence would be a source of strength. She realized that while she couldn't force him to feel better, she could be a beacon of support during his darkest moments. As the days passed, she noticed subtle changes in his demeanor, small signs that perhaps he was beginning to heal. She took these signs as a hopeful omen, a reminder that even in the darkest times, there is always a chance for improvement.

Era evidente que era desdichado, y ella habría deseado que fuera igualmente evidente que ella estaba dispuesta a escuchar cada una de sus preocupaciones. Sin embargo, el miedo a ser una molestia o a no ser suficientemente útil la mantenía callada. Decidió que debía ser más valiente y ofrecer su apoyo de corazón. Había prometido a sí misma ser una amiga verdadera, y ese era el momento de demostrarlo. Sin embargo, el peso de sus propias preocupaciones la mantenía a menudo inquieta y le impedía ofrecer el consuelo que deseaba dar. A pesar de todo, no podía dejar de pensar en cómo podría ayudar a su amigo a encontrar la paz interior que tanto necesitaba.

Bu kez arkadaşının gözleri parlamıştı ve Elinor, kendisinin de bu an için mutlu olduğunu hissetmişti. Bu küçük sevgi gösterisi, iki arkadaş arasındaki bağın güçlenmesine yardımcı olmuştu.

en_first_half: "It is very true," said Marianne, "that admiration of landscape scenery is become a mere jargon. Every body pretends to feel and tries to describe with the taste and elegance of him who first defined what picturesque beauty
en_second_half: was. I detest jargon of every kind, and sometimes I have kept my feelings to myself, because I could find no language to describe them in but what was worn and hackneyed out of all sense and meaning."
en_results: In a world where the superficiality of such pursuits often overshadows genuine appreciation, it is easy to see why the true beauty of nature is being lost. Yet, there are those who still seek to understand
en_results_raw: In a world where the superficiality of such pursuits often overshadows genuine appreciation, it is easy to see why the true beauty of nature is being lost. Yet, there are those who still seek to understand the deeper meanings behind the rolling hills and towering mountains. They find solace in the quiet moments when the wind whispers secrets through the trees, or when the sun paints the sky with hues of orange and pink. These individuals remind us that the language of nature is not just a matter of taste and elegance, but a profound connection to something greater than ourselves. It is a reminder that true appreciation comes not from pretense, but from a heart open to the world around it.

es_results_raw: La verdadera admiración, sin embargo, no se trata de imitar o describir, sino de comprender y respetar. Los paisajes naturales son más que simples escenarios; son testigos silenciosos de la historia de la Tierra y de la evolución de las especies. Es en ese entendimiento donde radica el verdadero valor de la admiración. Muchas veces, la belleza de un paisaje no se percibe con los ojos, sino con el alma. Es el silencio del bosque, el susurro del viento entre las hojas, el resplandor de un atardecer que nos recuerdan nuestra pequeña pero importante posición en este vasto universo. La verdadera admiración por los paisajes naturales es una invitación a la introspección y al respeto mutuo entre la humanidad y la naturaleza.

en_second_half: admire them much more if they are tall, straight, and flourishing. I do not like ruined, tattered cottages. I am not fond of nettles or thistles, or heath blossoms. I have more pleasure in a snug farm–house than a watch–tower—and a troop of tidy, happy villages please me better than the finest banditti in the world."

My sister, however, seems to find beauty in the irregularities, the way light filters through the branches, casting shadows that dance
en_results_raw: I find them unsettling, a reminder of nature's fragility and the passage of time. I prefer the symmetry of a well-tended garden, where every element contributes to a harmonious whole. My sister, however, seems to find beauty in the irregularities, the way light filters through the branches, casting shadows that dance on the ground. She speaks of the romance in decay, the way a fallen tree can become a haven for new life. I cannot deny that there is a certain charm in this perspective, but it is not one that resonates with me. Perhaps it is because I have always been more practical, more inclined to see the world through a lens of functionality and order. Yet, I admire her for her ability to find joy in the unexpected, in the imperfections that others might overlook. It is a lesson I hope to learn, for in her, I see a deeper connection to the world around us, one that I have perhaps been too busy to notice.

es_results_raw: Estoy convencido que la naturaleza en su plenitud, sin las deformidades que mencionas, es lo que verdaderamente aprecio. Me gusta el bosque que se extiende sin restricciones, donde cada hoja parece un pincelazo de color en un lienzo infinito. La montaña que se alza con firmeza, no como una criatura desvalida, sino como un testigo silencioso de los siglos. Me gusta el río que fluye con libertad, sin las curvas forzadas que parecen un esfuerzo desesperado. Mi hermana, por su parte, debe aceptar que no siempre puedo expresar lo que siento de la misma manera que ella lo hace. A veces, el silencio es más poderoso que las palabras, y en esos momentos, solo la belleza pura de la naturaleza puede comunicar lo que siento.

en_results_raw: Sir John's visits were always a welcome surprise for the Dashwoods, as they never knew what to expect. His invitations were a delightful tradition that brought the family together, strengthening their bonds. The park, with its lush gardens and grand halls, became a cherished meeting place. The tea and dinners were not just about food and drink; they were about conversation, laughter, and the sharing of stories. Sir John's charm and wit made these gatherings memorable, and the Dashwoods looked forward to each visit, eagerly anticipating the next adventure he would bring to their lives.

Mỗi lần đến, ông đều chuẩn bị những món ăn ngon và thức uống ngon để mọi người có một buổi tối vui vẻ. She found it easier to command her emotions when they were not as intense, but the challenge lay in maintaining composure during moments of heightened passion. Marianne often wondered if her own actions were as easily controlled as she believed. She considered the possibility that her own behavior had been more erratic, driven by the intensity of her feelings. The contrast between her and her sister, Elinor, was stark, and Marianne could not help but reflect on the different paths they had chosen. Elinor, with her calm and collected demeanor, seemed to have a more straightforward approach to life, while Marianne's turbulent emotions made her path more complex and unpredictable. Despite the challenges, Marianne was determined to find a balance, to understand herself better, and to navigate her feelings with more grace and control.

es_results_raw: Tras este análisis, Elinor comenzó a cuestionarse si realmente había encontrado en él algo que valiera la pena. Aunque su actitud inicial había sido de desconfianza y rechazo, ahora sentía una mezcla de curiosidad y compasión. Era evidente que había sufrido mucho, y aunque sufrimiento no justifica comportamientos groseros, ella no podía dejar de preguntarse si había algo más detrás de su actitud. Quizá, en su corazón, hubiera una persona que merecía ser comprendida y no solo juzgada por su apariencia. Elinor decidió darle una segunda oportunidad, no para cambiarlo, sino para entenderlo. A lo largo de los días siguientes, intentó observarlo con más atención, buscando señales de una personalidad más profunda. A medida que pasaban las horas, comenzó a notar pequeños gestos de bondad y empatía que, aunque no lo hacían menos desagradable, le daban una nueva perspectiva sobre él. No era perfecto, pero tampoco era el monstruo que ella había imaginado. Elinor se preguntaba si, tal vez, había algo en ella que también necesitaba ser comprendida. Esta reflexión la llevó a reconsiderar su propia actitud y a darse cuenta de que, en su afán por juzgar, había cometido un error. Desde ese momento, comenzó a tratar a todos con más respeto y empatía, comprendiendo que, detrás de cada persona, hay una historia única que merece ser escuchada.

Her laughter, a melody that dances through the air, has the power to lift my spirits in an instant. Despite her overwhelming affection, there is a certain reserve about her that adds to her allure. I find myself constantly trying to understand her, to unravel the layers of her heart, yet she remains an enigma. It is a challenge I find both daunting and exhilarating, and I cannot help but be drawn deeper into this whirlpool of passion and mystery.

She crumpled the letter in her hands, her knuckles turning white from the pressure. The room felt too small, too confining, as if the walls were closing in on her. She longed to run, to escape, but her feet were rooted to the spot. The silence was deafening, a stark contrast to the storm of emotions raging within her. She knew she had to do something, but what? She couldn't simply let this go, yet the thought of confronting him filled her with dread. The letter was a tangible reminder of the man she once trusted, now a stranger. She wished she could forget, but the memory of his betrayal was etched too deeply into her mind. In the end, she decided to seek counsel, hoping that someone else could offer a way forward. The journey to the lawyer's office felt interminable, each step a struggle against the weight of her own doubts and fears.

en_results_raw: You must not talk so, Marianne. Have you no comforts? no friends? Is your loss such as leaves no opening for consolation? Much as you suffer now, think of what you would have suffered if the discovery of his character had been delayed. Life is full of uncertainties, and sometimes, the worst moments can lead to the best outcomes. It is easy to be strong when everything is going well, but true resilience is found in the darkest of times. You have shown great strength in the face of adversity, and while it is natural to feel lost, remember that every cloud has a silver lining. The pain you feel now is a testament to the depth of your love and the importance of the person you lost. It is okay to grieve, but do not let it define you. There is always hope, and with time, the pain will lessen, allowing you to find peace and perhaps even new beginnings.

en_first_half: "His character is now before you; expensive, dissipated, and worse than both. Knowing all this, as I have now known it many weeks, guess what I must have felt on seeing your sister as fond of him as ever, and on being assured that she was to marry him: guess what I must have felt for all your sakes. When I came to you last week and found you alone, I came determined to know the truth; though irresolute what to do when it WAS known. My behaviour must have seemed strange to you then; but now you will comprehend it. To suffer you all to be so deceived; to see your sister—but what could I do? I had no hope of interfering with success; and sometimes I thought your sister's influence might yet reclaim him. But now, after such dishonorable usage, who can tell what were his designs on her. Whatever they may have been, however, she may now, and hereafter doubtless WILL turn with gratitude towards her own condition, when she compares it with that of
en_second_half: my poor Eliza, when she considers the wretched and hopeless situation of this poor girl, and pictures her to herself, with an affection for him so strong, still as strong as her own, and with a mind tormented by self–reproach, which must attend her through life. Surely this comparison must have its use with her. She will feel her own sufferings to be nothing. They proceed from no misconduct, and can bring no disgrace. On the contrary, every friend must be made still more her friend by them. Concern for her unhappiness, and respect for her fortitude under it, must strengthen every attachment. Use your own discretion, however, in communicating to her what I have told you. You must know best what will be its effect; but had I not seriously, and from my heart believed it might be of service, might lessen her regrets, I would not have suffered myself to trouble you with this account of my family afflictions, with a recital which may seem to have been intended to raise myself at the expense of others."
en_results: output>completion>Her own condition, when she compares it with that of the man she is about to marry. The thought of her future happiness, or rather, the lack thereof, weighed heavily on my mind. I could not bear the idea of her being ensnared by someone who had shown such disregard for her feelings and her well-being. The man she was to marry, the one she had once cherished, had now become a stranger to her, and to me. I could not bring myself to confront her directly, not after the way he had treated her. Instead, I chose to remain silent, hoping that time and distance would heal the wounds that had been inflicted.

vi_first_half: - Tư cách của anh giờ được đặt trước mặt cô - xa hoa, phóng đãng, và còn tệ hại hơn cả hai. Khi đã biết được tất cả - vì tôi đã biết được nhiều tuần rồi - cô thử đoán tôi đã nghĩ gì khi nhìn thấy em gái cô vẫn thân ái với anh ấy như bao giờ; và khi được tin em gái cô sẽ cưới anh ấy, thử đoán tôi đã nghĩ gì cho cô ấy. "Tuần rồi khi tôi đến đây và thấy cô chỉ có một mình, tôi đến với chủ định tìm hiểu sự thật; tuy không rõ mình sẽ làm gì một khi đã biết sự thật đau lòng. Lúc ấy cử chỉ của tôi hẳn là kỳ lạ đối với cô, nhưng bây giờ cô đã hiểu tại sao. Làm cho hai cô đau khổ thấy bị lừa dối như thế; thấy em gái cô... nhưng tôi làm gì được? Tôi không hy vọng ngăn cản được cuộc hôn nhân, và đôi lúc tôi nghĩ ảnh hưởng của em gái cô sẽ cảm hóa được anh ta." vi_second_half: em gái cô hẳn cảm thấy - sau này chắc chắn sẽ cảm thấy - là hoàn cảnh của mình còn may mắn. Em gái cô nên tưởng tượng mình là con bé kia; với tình cảm dành cho anh ta còn sâu đậm - cũng sâu đậm như chính tình cảm của em cô - với tư tưởng giằng xé vì tự trách mình, và tư tưởng này cứ vương vấn suốt đời. Chắc chắn so sánh này sẽ hữu ích cho em gái cô. Cô ấy sẽ thấy những khổ sở của mình không là gì cả. Đây chỉ là do hành vi sai lạc, chứ không làm ô nhục. Trái lại, các khổ sở này phải khiến mỗi bằng hữu của em gái cô trở thành bạn tốt hơn. Mối quan tâm tới bất hạnh của em gái cô, và lòng kính trọng cho sự chịu đựng bất hạnh này, phải cũng cố mọi quan hệ gắn bó." "Tuy nhiên, cô nên suy xét khi truyền đạt đến cô ấy những gì tôi đã kể cho cô nghe. Hẳn cô là người biết rõ hơn ai hết ảnh hưởng là như thế nào; nhưng nếu tôi đã không tin một cách nghiêm túc từ trong thâm tâm rằng mình có thể giúp ích, có thể xoa dịu tiếc nuối của em gái cô, thì tôi đã không chịu khổ sở để làm phiền cô vì câu chuyện đau buồn này trong gia đình tôi - có vẻ như với mục đích đề cao tôi và hạ nhục người khác."

es_first_half: —Ahora puede ver cómo es su carácter: derrochador, licencioso, y peor aún que eso. Sabiéndolo, como yo lo he sabido desde hace ya muchas semanas, imagínese lo que debo haber sentido al ver a su hermana tan afecta a él como siempre, y cuando se me aseguró que iba a casarse con él; imagínese lo que habré sentido pensando en todas ustedes. Cuando vine a verla la semana pasada y la encontré sola, estaba decidido a saber la verdad, aunque aún indeciso en cuanto a qué hacer cuando la supiera. Mi comportamiento debe haberle extrañado, pero ahora lo entenderá. Tener que verlas a todas ustedes engañadas en esa forma; ver a su hermana... pero, ¿qué podía hacer? No tenía esperanza alguna de intervenir con éxito; y en ocasiones pensaba que su hermana aún podía mantener suficiente influencia sobre él para recuperarlo. Pero tras un trato tan ignominioso, ¿quién sabe cuáles serían sus intenciones hacia ella? Cualesquiera hayan sido, sin embargo, puede que ahora ella se sienta agradecida de su situación, y sin duda más adelante lo estará, cuando la compare con la de mi pobre Eliza, cuando
es_second_half: piense en la situación miserable y desesperada de esta pobre niña y se la imagine con un afecto tan fuerte por él, tan fuerte como el que ella misma le tiene, y con un espíritu atormentado por las autorrecriminaciones, que la acompañarán durante toda su vida. Con toda seguridad esta comparación le servirá de algo. Sentirá que sus propios sufrimientos no son nada. No provienen de una mala conducta y no pueden traerle desgracia. Al contrario, deberán hacer que en cada uno de sus amigos aumente la amistad hacia ella. La preocupación por su desdicha y el respeto por la entereza que subyace a ella deberán reforzar todos los afectos. Utilice, sin embargo, su propia discreción para comunicarle lo que le he contado. Usted debe saber mejor qué efecto tendrá; y si no hubiera creído muy seriamente y desde el fondo de mi corazón que pudiera serle de alguna utilidad, que pudiera aliviar sus padecimientos, no me habría permitido perturbarla con este relato de las aflicciones que ha debido sufrir mi familia, una narración con la cual podría sospecharse que intento enaltecerme a costa de los demás.
es_results: output>Después de todo lo que he vivido, me doy cuenta de que mi decisión de no intervenir fue la única opción que tenía. No podía arriesgar la felicidad de mi hermana, ni la de ustedes, por un sentimiento de venganza que solo me hubiera llevado a la ruina. Aunque el dolor que siento es insoportable, sé que no puedo permitir que mis emociones me guíen. Mi hermana es una mujer fuerte, y aunque ahora pueda parecer que todo está perdido, estoy convencido de que ella encontrará el camino hacia la felicidad. No puedo evitar pensar en cómo sería mi vida si hubiera actuado de manera diferente, pero ya es demasiado tarde para lamentar lo que no hice. en_first_half: Marianne had promised to be guided by her mother's opinion, and she submitted to it therefore without opposition, though it proved perfectly different from what she wished and expected, though she felt it to be entirely wrong, formed on mistaken grounds, and
en_second_half: that by requiring her longer continuance in London it deprived her of the only possible alleviation of her wretchedness, the personal sympathy of her mother, and doomed her to such society and such scenes as must prevent her ever knowing a moment's rest.
en_results: Marianne found herself torn between her own desires and the unwavering guidance of her mother's wisdom. Each decision her mother made seemed to steer her further away from her dreams, yet Marianne clung to the hope that her mother's intentions were pure.
en_results_raw: Marianne found herself torn between her own desires and the unwavering guidance of her mother's wisdom. Each decision her mother made seemed to steer her further away from her dreams, yet Marianne clung to the hope that her mother's intentions were pure. The rift between them grew wider, and Marianne began to question the very foundation of her relationship. She longed for a moment of understanding, a conversation where both could express their true feelings without judgment. However, every attempt at reconciliation was met with a wall of silence, and Marianne's heart ached with the realization that her mother's love, though well-intentioned, was not enough to bridge the gap. In her solitude, Marianne vowed to find her own path, no matter the cost, determined to carve out a life that aligned with her own values and aspirations.

She quickly composed herself, extending her hand with a polite smile, and invited him to join them for tea. As they chatted, Elinor found herself intrigued by Mr. Dashwood's stories of his travels and his interest in the arts. The meeting was brief, but it left Elinor with much to think about, realizing that her initial business proposition might have to wait as she considered the possibility of a new alliance.

en_first_half: "I am extremely glad to hear it, upon my word; extremely glad indeed. But so it ought to be; they are people of large fortune, they are related to you, and every civility and accommodation that can serve to make your situation pleasant might be reasonably expected. And so you are most comfortably
en_second_half: settled in your little cottage and want for nothing! Edward brought us a most charming account of the place: the most complete thing of its kind, he said, that ever was, and you all seemed to enjoy it beyond any thing. It was a great satisfaction to us to hear it, I assure you."
en_results: I must say, it is a relief to hear that you are settled in such a manner. The thought of you being in any discomfort is something I could not bear. Your family's support and the fortune they have bestowed upon you are truly commendable. It is clear that they have a great deal of

Your family's support and the fortune they have bestowed upon you are truly commendable. It is clear that they have a great deal of affection for you, and this is evident in the way they have arranged everything for your comfort. I hope that this new chapter in your life brings you nothing but joy and prosperity. Yet, despite the comfort it provided, Marianne couldn't shake the feeling that something was missing, a void that her outings could not fill. As the days blended into one another, she began to wonder if her life was slipping away, one step at a time, into a pattern that no longer felt like her own.

She resolved to be stronger, to let go of what could not be, and to move forward with her life, even if it meant facing the future without him.

es_first_half: —Sí, una vez, cuando estaba alojada en esta casa. Me había dejado caer por unos diez minutos, y me bastó con lo que vi de ella. Una simple muchacha pueblerina, desmañada, sin estilo ni elegancia, y casi sin ningún atractivo. La recuerdo perfectamente. Justo el tipo de muchacha que habría creído capaz de cautivar al pobre Edward. Apenas mi madre me contó todo el asunto, de inmediato me ofrecí— a hablarle, a disuadirlo de la unión; pero, según pude darme cuenta, ya era demasiado tarde para hacer algo, pues por desgracia no estuve ahí en los primeros momentos y no supe nada
es_second_half: de lo ocurrido hasta después de la ruptura, cuando, ya sabe usted, no me correspondía interferir. Pero si se me hubiera informado unas pocas horas antes, probablemente habría podido hacer algo. De todas maneras le habría hecho ver las cosas a Edward con toda claridad. “Mi querido amigo”, le habría dicho, “piensa en lo que haces. Estás comprometiéndote en la más desafortunada unión, que toda tu familia desaprueba de manera unánime”. En fin, no puedo evitar pensar que habría encontrado alguna manera de lograrlo. Pero ahora es demasiado tarde. Debe estar muerto de hambre, sabe usted; con toda seguridad, absolutamente muerto de hambre.
es_results: output>Después de ese encuentro, me di cuenta de que Edward había sido engañado por su apariencia. La muchacha, que se llamaba Isabella, había sabido jugar con las emociones de Edward desde el principio. Era astuta y calculadora, y había logrado que Edward se enamorara de ella sin que él se diera cuenta de sus verdaderos motivos. Isabella era de una familia adinerada, y su intención era casarse con Edward para acceder a su fortuna. Sin embargo, Edward, con su corazón tan vulnerable, no había visto más allá de su apariencia.
